comment.text: The food was amazing! Really authentic, especially if you've been to Thailand. Highly recommend. So flavorful!

It's been awhile, I've missed this place. 

Stopped in for lunch. I love when I can dine uninterrupted. 

Not a large crowd, good service, decent time delivery of food and always piping hot. Definitely not microwaved. 

So there you have it, daytime, evening and special occasion I've tried it and never had a bad experience.

I visited this place to try it for a friend's wedding a year ago and here is a summary of my experience:

1) Ambiance 4/5: The ambiance is good and the place looks upscale and trendy that attracts a great crowd. The only problem is that their event hall is really small and long

2) Service 5/5: The service was great and the staff their helped with the menu and suggestions

3) Food 4/5: We ordered different courses and here is the summary of our experience

a) Crab Rangoon: It was crispy and tasty and we also liked the sauce with it
b) Pad Thai with chicken: I liked the taste and the quantity and we had some leftovers to take home.
c) Masaman curry: The masaman curry portion was huge but it was a little too sweet to my liking

4) Value for money 4/5: It is not the cheapest place but also it is in Buckhead so if money is not a concern, this is a place to try.

Overall, worth a try if you like that food and money is not a concern.

Picked this spot purely on Yelp rating and closeness to home.
Arrived about an hour before closing (my usual habit) - The weird and tight parking deck was empty so a little odd.
Pleasantly surprised after arriving in the lobby which I assume shares an office bldg.
Atmosphere was very warm and I'd even say romantic.
Decor is modern and minimalist but with nice Asian accents.
We got the Drunken Noodles with Tofu and Masaman Curry with Shrimp.
Both dishes elegantly served and all the flavors were on point. Though a touch salty with the Noodle dish.
Noodles offered plenty to eat while the Shrimp Curry left me wanting a bit more but we shared so it all worked out! .
I would definitely go back as their private room looks super nice with all the decorations and huge table for a group.

Door dashed twice this week so I could write a review on the take out. No pictures because I inhaled the food upon receiving it. I started with the tofu pad Thai and it was a great portion. Plenty of spongy tofu and noodles the only thing I wanted more of was veggies. It was flavorful and the noodles were cooked well.
I also tried the green curry with vegetables level 3 spicy and it was SPICY! Green curry has a kick anyway but I added coconut milk to it and that did the trick it was delish.I had leftover sauce and made some more veggies and had a second dinner that week.  I also ordered the roti slices and I wish they would have gave a bit more for the price. I Highly recommend nonetheless.

This was a first time for me here. Came here on a night that Alabama was playing so I'm glad there was a bar for me to sit at while I waited for the rest of my party to arrive. The hostess was very nice upon arrival and check-in. Everyone was so attentive and friendly and I appreciated that from the very beginning. The food was amazing and for the party of about 10 we had they handled everything so quickly and together which I'm always weary about with parties. I definitely would return here for a more intimate date night or with family!

Went in for a weekday dinner for girls night out. Great ambience and friendly staff. Fried calamari was good for appetizer. Huge disappointment on the noodle dish (pad see ew) which was cold and dry (almost wanted to send it back). I think they cooked it and sat it out for a while until they were done with the other dish we ordered (fried soft shell crab curry). Soft shell crab was

I've just found my new favorite Thai restaurant in Buckhead! Everything is super flavorful & the service is top notch. My date & I went for the first time on a Friday evening & although we had reservations, service was overall immaculate from the speed of receiving our food to the attentiveness to our table. It's truly a hidden gem! Parking may look confusing at first but there are signs directing you to parking for BS.

photos.caption: Pork Belly Chashu Ramen at Bangkok Station | Atlanta, GA
Brussel Sprouts at Bangkok Station | Atlanta, GA
Lychee Martini at Bangkok Station | Atlanta, GA

comment.text:
Last Friday me and my boo went on a date to Bangkok station before heading out and I was pleasantly surprised. When it came to ordering, we stuck to trying a bunch of their signature cocktails and appetizers.

The fried wings were our favorite. We ended up ordering them three times, we also had the spring rolls as well as the crab Rangoon. Everything was really good, but there's no bearing those fried wings! An added bonus is that they already came all flat !!

We sat at the bar and service was relatively quick on everything that we had, the bartender was pretty busy being that it was Friday night, but he did check in with us a ton of times to make sure that we were OK and was really good when it came to recommendations on the drinks. We had the Pattaya punch, Bangkok mule, and lychee martini, which Yum to say the least. 

Definitely a space for a Instagram of all photos and my personal favorite a great view of the playoff game :))))))

Bangkok Stations was amazing. The experience was very pleasant and the food was amazing. A friend and I went to catch up and almost ended up sampling the whole menu. Each items we ordered had so much flavor. This is now one of my favorite Thai restaurants. I ordered the shrimp basil rice and added chicken. It was so delicious. My friend ordered the crab Rangoon appetizers and those little gems were so creamy and the dipping sauce paired really nice with it as well. We ended up getting the coconut cake for the table and my oh my. The cake had a vanilla base with a hint of coconut. It wasn't overwhelming at all. They made me a believer because I normally despise coconut cake because it always has a funny taste to me but they did a great job with everything. I will definitely be going back ! Also, parking is in the lower deck and is free so that's another added bonus.

photos.caption: Shrimp basil rice with added chicken

comment.text: $10 for a half cup of soup. Who wants a half cup or soup? It was $17 . Hideous ripoff

Went here a few weeks ago and the food was so good I ate it all before I could take a picture! Cocktails are also delicious! It is a little more upscale inside than I was expecting, but still casual and good for date night (or even a first date!). Service was good as well. We will definitely be making this a regular spot for yummy Thai food!

First time being back in 4ys! Food was even better than I remembered. Good decent portion, reallly flavorful. Also, they serve sushi now! There wasn't a lunch special and was a bit understaffed (2-4 ppl working total). But the food came out fairly quickly.

I came here for a friend's birthday and was pleasantly surprised. I think this is one of Atlantas hidden gems because everything was great. The food was so flavorful and the portions were big. The drinks were amazing and cheap. That's something you don't see often in Atlanta. The restaurant itself is beautiful, great for a date night or just a night out with friends. And the customer service is what sold me. The manager was so attentive to our table and all of the other waiters were just as nice too. I will definitely be coming back.

I've been here a few times now. I really like the ambience and layout - it feels really light and airy. They have all your usual thai dishes. From what I've tried I think I enjoy the pad thai the most. I normally love a whole fried fish but they serve theirs by taking the fish off the bone and serving it in nugget pieces. I know a lot of people are afraid of the bones when eating a whole fish but served this way I got less fish and more breading. Regardless, I think this is a nice option for Thai in the area at a decent price but I wouldn't order the fish again.

Was visiting Atlanta and was recommended this restaurant by a friend! Boy did it exceed my expectations! If you are in Atlanta and craving good Thai food look no further.

I had the coconut chicken soup as an appetizer and the green chicken curry - both SO GOOD! I'm still dreaming about it today and I am back in my hometown. 

Definitely recommend!

I just ordered a pad see u from them and it's nasty afff. Tastes like the sea but bland. I'm so sad because I'm starving and have been waiting 30+ minutes for this. I haven't ate all day. And you know food tastes good when you're starving but, not this time. Looking for something else to eat now. $30 wasted. Ughhhh

The food was wonderful, but it wasn't spicy, so if you like spice, ask for more! The restaurant is beautiful, and I love their seating and decor. Great for large or small parties. Service was pretty slow, and we could have used a few more stops by our table, but other than that, it was a nice dining experience

Bangkok Station was my go to for Thai delivery in Atlanta but the last 2 times has been awful. This time I had to write a review. I ordered Basil chicken, which I have ordered several times before. It's about $20-21 but of course with Uber eats delivery charges and fees and tip it is wayyyyy more than that! I waited an hour for my food and this is what came! They did not even have the decency to fill the container! One entire corner is missing! I ate all of this. There was not enough for 2 people.

My daughter and I went for dinner and things were perfect.  I loved the ambiance, food and friendly servers. 
I will come back again.

Thank you!

Literally one of the most impressive restaurants I have ever eating at. With every bite of my meal I fell more and more in love with the place. Service was absolutely amazing and the ambiance of the location and room was upscale and simple very cool vibe. I recommend anyone in the state of Georgia go visit this place!!!

What an interesting turn of events. My sisters and I came here for Christmas dinner! Not what we were expecting, but we are so glad with the outcome. Bangkok station is close to the Buckhead, Village and Atlanta. I had no idea this restaurant was here, and I think I will be returning! my sisters, and I wanted to make the most of canceled flights and came here for our dinner, and we were not disappointed. We ordered a variety of things. We shared a soup, which was so well presented with a burning flame in the middle and was kept hot throughout the time we enjoyed it. We also ordered softshell, crab salad, two hole squares, the land and ocean, which is a chef inspired dish that you cannot make changes to, which we didn't mind because it was delicious as well. Everything was so flavorful, and, they hit the mark on every single dish. There wasn't anything that we wanted to return, our service was lovely, and we ordered drinks. I believe my sister ordered a hot toddy, one of my other sisters, ordered a frozen, piña colada, drink, and I ordered a Hot sake. Lovely service, lovely people, great ambience of the restaurant and I can't wait to come back!

The only reason I'm giving this restaurant four stars and not five is because it is super drafty in here. The nicer tables in my opinion are close to the windows, and there is a breeze that whistles through the walls and had us freezing LOL they did have space heaters around the restaurant, but they were not pumping enough to ignore the cold coming off of the walls unfortunately. There were some pillows for you to place at your back, but it was just so cold. Our feet were frozen throughout the whole night.

A tasty  hidden gem , right here in Buckhead. I had no place this delicious Thai food spot was in this area and I wish I knew sooner. 

I gave the cocorita cocktail a try and let's just say I ended up drinking two of them. It was perfect. I also tried the three flavor fried red snapper and boy do they make a flavorful fried red snapper. I can't wait to comeback for it again. I also enjoyed the heat  from the green curry with salmon dish. 

I recommend you come directly after work for a good relaxing experience.

photos.caption: Three flavors Whole Red Snapper. So good
Three flavors Whole Red Snapper. Must try

comment.text:
I have attended this for a while, and never was i ever dissatisfied.  Today I ordered calamari and wings for lunch.  I was aware I was ordering 4 wings, HOWEVER i was disappointed on the portion of calamari.  I received a bunch of noodles and and with a half size of a palm portion of calamari.  BEWARE of their takeout when ordering there calamari.

Disgusted.

Restaurant was pretty empty on a friday night, but it was close to closing time. The ambiance is nice and the decor feels casual yet a little bit upscale. My boyfriend ordered the cashew pri pok with chicken. We never had this dish before so we don't know whether it was good or bad, only complaint is that it was kind of cold. I had the
Pad thai moo thod, which is pad thai with fried fatty pork. It was good, but it wasnt really great. The peanut chunks were a bit too powdery and i almost choked on it though. The calamari appetizer was also alright and it came with a yummy sweet pineapple sauce, which also paired well with my fried pork. I think it would be a nice addition to have the dipping sauce with the pork.
I ordered the Crab Rice and seafood. I enjoyed the meal and the Crab Rangoon as an appetizer. Everyone seemed to enjoy their food. I wish the food had a tad more seasoning but no complaints.

This was my first visit to Bangkok station. It won't be my last. I put the quality of their food as good, if not better than Nan Thai restaurant in midtown.  The decor is the only difference. If you're looking for good, quality and authentic Thai food, you can't go wrong.  I've had the opportunity to visit Pattaya several times. Eating at this restaurant made me feel I was back in Thailand.  Give them a try. You can't go wrong!  I had the fried snapper. If you order that, ask for a side of their yellow curry to pour over the fish.  So so good!
Really good Panang curry. Service was great. Portions were large enough for leftovers. Definitely will eat there again.

Wow! Talk about delicious food and great serving portions. Probably one of the best meals I've had in along time. I certainly recommend to make a reservation and try the gyoza! I would come back to even celebrate my birthday! Thanks again for the service and great food!

Small portions for the high price and extremely spicy drunken noodles (at level 2), missing the order notes most of the time but cooked well and presented nicely. The quality of the food and amount given used to be better months ago but has significantly declined. This was my favorite Thai restaurant in the Atlanta area, after moving from NYC. I don't know if the kitchen staff has changed or management has, but my orders are usually made wrong, missing the specified spice level or very small portions clumped together. Fortunately, they are always vegetarian though. I keep trying to give them another chance, knowing how great they used to be but keep getting let down. If you're on the fence, I would give them at least one chance.

Ambiance, decor and service was wonderful. The food was disappointing. Portions were small for the price that they charged. We ordered 2 appetizers, Thai hotpot, Shrimp Pad Thai and mango with sticky rice dessert. I've been to many Thai restaurants before and definitely know what good Thai food taste like. This was average and was not worth the price. If you want to come here for ambiance and service and average food, then this is it. Otherwise, I would try another place with better food and value.

photos.caption: Sticky rice with mango and coconut milk

comment.text: We discovered this Thai restaurant sometime last year in July '21 and it was an amazing experience that we decided to come for lunch this time. This review has photos from our first time (food has a flower) and second time (no flower). The spring rolls are a hit, crunchy and flavorful. Drinks are good, and for the Coco-Rita, I didn't get to keep the mug lol

photos.caption: BKK Thai Tea Rum - Malibu Black and Homemade Thai tea and cream - 7/10
BKK Thai Tea Rum - Malibu Black and Homemade Thai tea and cream
Fresh Love - Hendrick's Gin, Cucumber, Basil, Ginger Homemade Lemongrass sour mix
Drunken Man Noodle - w/ Tofu and no eggs
Coco-Rita - 1800 Coconut Silver (Tequila), sour mix, pineapple juice and orange liquor -- 8/10

comment.text: I ordered food for delivery and it was so disappointing. The price does not match the portions by any means. I'm not asking for a boat load of food, but the amount of food received does not match the price. I will not order from here again. You get way less than what you pay for. I ordered the chicken coconut soup, chicken larb and the papaya salad.  You barely get any soup. Imagine the smallest container possible with barely anything in it but broth. The chicken larb was super salty! The papaya salad might as well have been non-existent because the tray contained half a cabbage in it and a cup of papaya salad. Very disappointed in how a business would operate this way. On Uber eats, they are under this business name and listed as "Eat Thai", so diners beware.
This is a hidden gem in Buckhead. The rice cake spicy tuna was awesome.  Also loved the panang shrimp and scallops. I can't wait to go back and try the duck with Brussels sprouts!!

photos.caption: Special of the day spicy tuna on rice cakes

comment.text: I have no words to describe this place. Found it on Google and it was glad that I did. This place is a hidden gem and it's the best Thai food I've had in Atlanta. The food is amazing and it taste so fresh. I had Bkk Crispy Rolls, Shrimp Fried Rice, Shrimp Basil Rice, Coconut Cake and I'd give each dish a 10! It's to the point where I can't wait to come back. The service was great and the ambiance was so sexy! This is now one of my favorite restaurants in Atlanta!

This is, hands-down, the best Thai restaurant I have been to in Atlanta. We ordered 3 items - BKK Seafood Hotpot, Thai Papaya Salad, and Muk Yang (char-grilled whole octopus, which is a Thai Seafood festival special this year) - and loved every single dish.

Where to start, I believe the devil is in the detail when it comes to a good dinning experience, and they have nailed the detail. The Seafood hotpot was FILLED with seafood, and the papaya salad was FRESH down to the garnishing carrots (yes, I ate that too, b/c it was THAT good). The Muk Yang was tender and just the right chewy-ness, which is hard to say when you take a gamble and order octopus at many restaurants. But what surprised and delighted me was the side fried rice that came with the octopus, it was THE BEST FRIED rice I had since I came to the State; it had WOK HAY.

10/10 food and atmosphere, they are a bit short-staffed but still tries their best to take care of customers. I am definitely coming back again.

We had a wonderful experience today. Something I ate didn't agree with me and not only did they comp that meal, they gave me a different meal for free. They will definitely have my business in the future. And if you have any problems or questions, please speak to Ann, the manager. She's amazing!
Great food and drinks. I've been a few times but on my last visit the service was a bit slow. Overall I'd still recommend trying it. Perfect for any occasion. Free parking also
The bar service is amazing the food is amazing will def be back. I absolutely love the food and presentation. The drinks are perfect!!!

If you like Thai food, definitely stop by Bangkok Station.
Went with a couple friends on a Saturday night. We were seated immediately. Staff and service was pleasant and quick!
All the drinks are pretty to look at with all the decorations. I got the mule which was fantastic. We ordered the calamari and crispy spring rolls for apps. They were each very good with delicious side sauce. For dinner, I had the ginger chicken with steam rice on the side. I finished my entire plate, that's how good it was! The chicken was flavorful and with a bit of a kick that wasn't overwhelming. Everything was second to none.
Great spot!

GUYS i am obsessed with Thai food and this IS THE PLACE to be. 
We stopped there for lunch on a weekday and had some of their lunch specials. I ordered the chicken pad thai and requested it to be spicy and they did not hold back. It was absolutely perfect! 
Not to mention the amount of Pad thai you get for 10$, I ate half and was full, already being excited for my leftover dinner. 
You can't not be impressed with this place, the decor is absolutely beautiful. It is clean and spacious and they even have a really nice patio. 
Taste, flavor, quality, quantity, price, the friendly customer service, there was not one criteria that they did not excel in. 
Will definitely be back! Ki

If I could give this place six stars I would!
I came here for a birthday dinner with some of my friends and none of us left disappointed. From the drinks to the large family style plates and even the wait staff, there was nothing left to be desired. 
One of the best Thai restaurants I have been to in Atlanta and I will definitely be back to try out the rest of the menu!

Our first time here was to celebrate our "dating" anniversary of 6 years. We're big Thai food lovers, and wanted to try a new place. Our first experience was so excellent and our server Pei (I hope I'm spelling that right) was so lovely and helpful. And made some mean cocktails! 

It was enough for us to choose Bangkok Station for our wedding dinner celebration. We had a small court ceremony with family, and wanted to keep the dinner similar - private, joyful, and peaceful. And the private dining room here is just that - big enough for maybe 15 people or more, we were only 5, but the manager (who is always super nice) arranged it so beautifully. I wish I could share more pictures but my family's in all of them! 

The food was just delicious. No two ways about it. We ordered a LOT of food. Leftovers lasted for two more meals. The red snapper special was awesome, as you can see in the picture. I had the crying tiger steak special myself, and fully intend to order that again the next time I visit. 

The appetizers are awesome. And there's a good balance between authentic Thai, and some slightly American-friendly versions too. 

The fact that they offer "Thai-hot" as a spice level was very welcome for my Indian family and their over-stimulated taste buds. 

Another star of the experience was our server Tony. He was just great. There when we needed him, gone when we didn't. Polite, helpful, I've got no notes for him. 

Highly recommended to anyone in the mood for some damn good Thai food.

photos.caption: Sweet and Sour chicken, Thai Green curry, Basil Fried Rice

comment.text: Met a friend here for her 50th birthday dinner. The crab fried rice was DIVINE as was the Red Snapper. Unfortunately the green and red curry were just average at best. But Bangkok Station makes up for average curry with their yummy cocktails and excellent service. They also have a wonderful patio. I'll be back for the snapper!!
Me and my husband came here a our date night, Their food was delicious, They have garage parking, which is a plus for us being it's in Atlanta. Customer service was great. we will be back.

The food here was great. My family and I stumbled upon the place and we all found something that we enjoyed. I was not totally in love with the soup as coconut milk is not my favorite. The entree itself was excellent. I would recommend and we will go again when we are in the area.

Just picked up take out. One of the items I ordered was Tom Yum soup. It came in a small container that was half full It only had 3 shrimp and 2 mushrooms and it was $12. Ridiculous!!
I ordered spice level 3 out of 5 and it was over the spicy.
Also ordered basil roll that totally unraveled, when I opened it, it looked like  a salad with absolutely no flavor.
Overpriced and poor execution.
Save you time and miney.

Went here for lunch with some business partners. I always do to go for this restaurant and the food was mediocre. It was a different story when we dining in though. The food came out so quick and hot and Jesus everything was so so good. We had a picky eater in the group and she liked everything that was brought out. I will say one thing is that for it to be slow; service could be better. Our server was talking on the side with a coworker oat of our visit. He was super nice and sweet though. I would recommend be a little more attentive. Other than that everything was great even valet. Until next time!!! Peace

Me and my girlfriend both had the Red Snapper and let me tell you ...it was amazing. The fish was perfectly fried and the sauce paired with it was perfectly sweet and savory. The drink were amazing tho I can't remember the name of them lol. The ambience was very relaxing and classy. Our waiter was very friendly and accommodating. 10/10 would come back
Very good sushi freshly made. Ambiance and the look of the restaurant are outstanding. Good service but could be a little faster. Try it.
